00018 #define IQ_STATUS_RUNNING   1

00020

00022 #define  IQ_TURN_BP_ON(iq)      ((iq)->status |= IQ_STATUS_BP_ON)
00023 #define  IQ_TURN_BP_OFF(iq)     ((iq)->status &= ~(IQ_STATUS_BP_ON))
00024 #define  IQ_CHECK_BP_ON(iq)     ((iq)->status & IQ_STATUS_BP_ON)

00075 /** The instruction (input) queue. 
00076     The input queue is used to post raw (instruction) mode data or packet
00077     data to Octeon device from the host. Each input queue (upto 4) for
00078     a Octeon device has one such structure to represent it.
00079 */
00080 typedef struct   {
00081 
00082   /** A spinlock to protect access to the input ring.  */
00083    cavium_spinlock_t     lock;
00084 
00085   /** Flag that indicates if the queue uses 64 byte commands. */
00086   uint32_t               iqcmd_64B:1;
00087 
00088   /** Queue Number. */
00089   uint32_t               iq_no:5;
00090 
00091   uint32_t               rsvd:18;
00092 
00093   uint32_t               status:8;
00094 
00095   /** Maximum no. of instructions in this queue. */
00096    uint32_t              max_count;
00097 
00098 #if !defined(DISABLE_PCIE14425_ERRATAFIX)
00099    /** Count of packets that were not sent due to backpressure.  */
00100    uint32_t              bp_hits;
00101 #endif
00102 
00103   /** Index in input ring where the driver should write the next packet. */
00104    uint32_t              host_write_index;
00105 
00106   /** Index in input ring where Octeon is expected to read the next packet. */
00107    uint32_t              octeon_read_index;
00108 
00109   /** This index aids in finding the window in the queue where Octeon 
00110       has read the commands. */
00111    uint32_t              flush_index;
00112 
00113   /** This field keeps track of the instructions pending in this queue. */
00114    cavium_atomic_t       instr_pending;
00115 
00116    uint32_t              reset_instr_cnt;
00117 
00118   /** Pointer to the Virtual Base addr of the input ring. */
00119    uint8_t              *base_addr;
00120 
00121    octeon_noresponse_list_t    *nrlist;
00122 
00123    struct oct_noresp_free_list nr_free;
00124 
00125   /** Octeon doorbell register for the ring. */
00126    void                 *doorbell_reg;
00127 
00128   /** Octeon instruction count register for this ring. */
00129    void                 *inst_cnt_reg;
00130 
00131 
00132   /** Number of instructions pending to be posted to Octeon. */
00133    uint32_t              fill_cnt;
00134 
00135   /** The max. number of instructions that can be held pending by the driver. */
00136    uint32_t              fill_threshold;
00137 
00138   /** The last time that the doorbell was rung. The unit is OS-dependent. */
00139    unsigned long         last_db_time;
00140 
00141   /** The doorbell timeout. If the doorbell was not rung for this time and 
00142       fill_cnt is non-zero, ring the doorbell again. */
00143    unsigned long         db_timeout;
00144 
00145   /** Statistics for this input queue. */
00146   oct_iq_stats_t         stats;
00147 
00148   /** DMA mapped base address of the input descriptor ring. */
00149    unsigned long          base_addr_dma;
00150 
00151 }  octeon_instr_queue_t;
00152 
00153

00155 typedef octeon_instr_queue_t   octeon_iq_t;

00160 /*----------------------  INSTRUCTION FORMAT ----------------------------*/
00161 
00162 
00163 /** 32-byte instruction format.
00164     Format of instruction for a 32-byte mode input queue.
00165 */
00166 typedef struct   {
00167 
00168   /** Pointer where the input data is available. */
00169   uint64_t             dptr;
00170 
00171   /** Instruction Header.  */
00172   uint64_t             ih;
00173 
00174   /** Pointer where the response for a RAW mode packet will be written
00175       by Octeon. */
00176   uint64_t             rptr;
00177 
00178   /** Input Request Header. Additional info about the input. */
00179   uint64_t             irh;
00180 
00181 }octeon_instr_32B_t;
00182 
00183 #define OCT_32B_INSTR_SIZE     (sizeof(octeon_instr_32B_t))
00184 
00185 
00186 
00187 /** 64-byte instruction format.
00188     Format of instruction for a 64-byte mode input queue.
00189 */
00190 typedef struct  {
00191 
00192   /** Pointer where the input data is available. */
00193   uint64_t             dptr;
00194 
00195   /** Instruction Header. */
00196   uint64_t             ih;
00197 
00198   /** Pointer where the response for a RAW mode packet will be written
00199       by Octeon. */
00200   uint64_t             rptr;
00201 
00202   /** Input Request Header. */
00203   uint64_t             irh;
00204 
00205   /** Additional headers available in a 64-byte instruction. */
00206   uint64_t             exhdr[4];
00207 
00208 }octeon_instr_64B_t;
00209 
00210 #define OCT_64B_INSTR_SIZE     (sizeof(octeon_instr_64B_t))

00214 /**
00215  *  octeon_init_instr_queue()
00216  *  @param octeon_dev      - pointer to the octeon device structure.
00217  *  @param octeon_iq_conf  - configuration parameters for this input queue. 
00218  *  @param iq_no           - queue to be initialized (0 <= q_no <= 3).
00219  *
00220  *  Called at driver init time for each input queue. iq_conf has the 
00221  *  configuration parameters for the queue.
00222  *
00223  *  @return  Success: 0   Failure: 1
00224  */
00225 int   octeon_init_instr_queue(octeon_device_t     *octeon_dev,
00226                               int                  iq_no );
00227 
00228 
00229 
00230 /**
00231  *  octeon_delete_instr_queue()
00232  *  @param octeon_dev      - pointer to the octeon device structure.
00233  *  @param iq_no           - queue to be deleted (0 <= q_no <= 3).
00234  *
00235  *  Called at driver unload time for each input queue. Deletes all
00236  *  allocated resources for the input queue.
00237  *
00238  *  @return  Success: 0   Failure: 1
00239  */
00240 int   octeon_delete_instr_queue(octeon_device_t     *octeon_dev,
00241                                 int                  iq_no);

00247 wait_for_instr_fetch(octeon_device_t  *oct);

00251 /** API exported to other modules that want to post a command directly
00252   * into the Input queue. This way of sending a command to Octeon does not
00253   * provide for notification of completion or for a callback. Most modules
00254   * will not use this.
00255   * @param oct - octeon device pointer
00256   * @param iq  - pointer to the input queue to which the command is posted
00257   * @param force_db - flag indicating if the input queue doorbell should be
00258   *                   rung after this command is posted.
00259   * @param cmd - pointer to the 32-byte command structure.
00260   */
00261 int 
00262 octeon_iq_post_command(octeon_device_t       *oct,
00263                        octeon_instr_queue_t  *iq,
00264                        uint32_t               force_db,
00265                        void                  *cmd);
00266

00268 #define NORESP_SEND_OK       IQ_SEND_OK
00269 #define NORESP_SEND_STOP     IQ_SEND_STOP
00270 #define NORESP_SEND_FAILED   IQ_SEND_FAILED
00271 
00272 
00273 int
00274 octeon_send_noresponse_command(octeon_device_t   *oct,
00275                                int                iq_no,
00276                                int                force_db,
00277                                void              *cmd,
00278                                void              *buf,
00279                                int                datasize,
00280                                int                buftype);

00283 
00284 /** API exported so that modules like octeon NIC module can flush the input
00285   * queue to which they had posted a command before.
00286   * @param oct - octeon device pointer
00287   * @param iq  - pointer to the octeon device input queue that will be flushed
00288   */
00289 void
00290 octeon_flush_iq(octeon_device_t   *oct, octeon_instr_queue_t  *iq);

00293 void
00294 octeon_perf_flush_iq(octeon_device_t   *oct, octeon_instr_queue_t  *iq);
